alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Des Moines; Louisa; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 8:07PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Henderson, Rock Island, Mercer, southwestern Whiteside, northern Warren, Henry, northwestern Bureau, southeastern Cedar, eastern Muscatine, northeastern Des Moines, southeastern Louisa, Scott and southeastern Clinton Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 806 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from West Jersey to near Woodhull to near Rozetta. Movement was north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 to 45 mph. At 755 PM, a wind gust of 45 MPH was measured at the Galesburg Airport. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Bettendorf, Clinton, Muscatine, East Moline, Kewanee, Aledo, Cambridge, Durant, Oquawka, Silvis, Geneseo, Eldridge, Milan, Colona, Camanche, Le Claire and Coal Valley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 277 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 40. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 21. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cedar; Clinton; Des Moines; Louisa; Muscatine; Scott
